definition[0]: a foolish action, remark etc is stupid and shows that someone is not thinking sensibly
example[0]: I’ve never heard anything so foolish in all my life.
example[1]: It would be foolish to ignore his advice.
example[2]: I was foolish enough to believe him.
note[0]: be foolish enough to do something
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say silly or stupid rather than foolish:
example[3]: It was a silly thing to say.
example[4]: I felt a bit stupid when she said no.
definition[1]: a foolish person behaves in a silly way or looks silly
example[5]: I was young and foolish at the time.
example[7]: He’d been made to look foolish.
